descriptionNullable:
Vehicle Recognition Dataset-2022

Accelerometer and gyroscope data were collected by the Vieyra Software app on a Google Pixel 4XL smartphone for the bicycle, bus, and Toyota Camry 2005. Accelerometer and gyroscope data were collected by the Vieyra Software app on a Samsung Galaxy phone for a bicycle, train, and Honda Insight 2013.

File description: 
bike.csv [City, No Traffic light, Clear Weather, Google Pixel]
bus.csv [City, No Traffic light, Clear Weather,  Google Pixel]
car-city-newark-light-rain.csv [City, Traffic light, Rain, Samsung Galaxy]
car-clear.csv (Honda) [City, No Traffic light, Clear Weather, Samsung Galaxy]
car-clear2.csv (Toyota) [City, No Traffic light, Clear Weather, Google Pixel]
car-rain.csv (Honda) [City, No Traffic light, Rain, Samsung Galaxy]
rail.csv [City, No Traffic light, Clear Weather, Samsung Galaxy]

Column Description:
ax, ay, az: accelerometer sensor data
wx, wy, wz: gyroscope sensor data
gFx, gFy, gFz: gravity sensor data

Result:
ML-Accuracy
Logistic Regression-45.36%
Naive Bayes-58.13%
SVM-76.12%
XGBoost-84.73%
CNN-98%

Corresponding paper:
Pias, Tanmoy Sarkar, David Eisenberg, and Jorge Fresneda Fernandez. "Accuracy Improvement of Vehicle Recognition by Using Smart Device Sensors." Sensors 22, no. 12 (2022): 4397.
https://www.mdpi.com/1671762 

Code:
https://github.com/PiasTanmoy/Vehicle-Recognition-Using-Smart-Sensors
title: Vehicle Recognition Dataset
subtitle: Accuracy Improvement Challenge!
